abstract.p: Companhia de Bebidas das Americas of Brazil, largest beverage manufacturer in Latin America, could receive approval this week from Securities and Exchange Commission in US to sell shares on New York Stock Exchange (S)

block.p: The largest beverage manufacturer in Latin America, Companhia de Bebidas das Americas of Brazil, or AmBev, could receive approval this week from the Securities and Exchange Commission in the United States to sell shares on the New York Stock Exchange. The shares, in the form of American depository receipts, could start trading in early September. Stockholders in Companhia Cervejaria Brahma, which already trades shares on the Big Board and the Sao Paulo Bovespa, will be given AmBev shares in exchange. AmBev was formed by the $7 billion merger last year of Cervejaria Brahma and Companhia Antarctica Paulista. The company makes 18 brands of beer, 37 soft drinks and 7 brands of bottled water.
